intro: Phyllanthus dallachyanus, commonly known as the Armenian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a shrub characterized by its small, smooth, oval-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in mountainous areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in temperate climates.
